title: Jim Beam (All Fonts Used)
content:
Please help looking for ALL fonts used on the original Jim Beam bottle

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jb_3442.jpg)

The World's Finest Bourbon - Some type of Western font, maybe cowboys or Anderson Thunderbirds Are GO!

Jim Beam - looks like Bernard MT Condensed but not exact I'd like a better one

Beam Formula - Futura (Bold) [Thx to Rynk]

B

Sour Mash - Engravers [Thx to Rynk]

Kentucky Straight

None Genuine - Bank Gothic [Thx to Rynk]

Distilled By - Engravers [Thx to Rynk]

James B. Beam Distilling Co.

Beam . Clermont - Blair/Engravers Gothic [Thx to Rynk]

70cl - Univers UltraCondensed [Thx to Rynk]

Any more help would be greatly appreciated.

Font: 

 Univers UltraCondensed 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: TimBisley

comments.content:
BEAM FORMULA: most probably [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Futura) Condensed (Bold)  
SOUR MASH/DISTILLED BY: [Sackers](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/sackers)  
NONE GENUINE...: [Bank Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Bank+gothic)  
James B. Beam: appears to be hand-done as all repeating letters are different  
BEAM/CLAIRMONT: [Blair](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Blair)/ [Engravers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Engravers+gothic)  
70cl/40%vol: [Univers](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/univers) UltraCondensed might do the job, as usual for this kind of packaging label

Thanks so much Ryuk great start,  
sorry not the signature the James B. Beam Distilling Co.

The World's Finest Bourbon: a squooshed [Old Towne](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/old+towne) might work; alternatives: [Norwich Aldine](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/norwich-aldine-ml), [Cloverdale](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/cloverdale), [Boonville](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/boonville)  
Jim Beam: most probably custom  
Kentucky Straight: again, custom to me; looks to mix [Alternate Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/alternate+gothic) and [Morris Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/morris+sans)/ [Bank Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/bank+gothic)/ [Bank Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/bank+sans)/ [Banque Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/banque+gothic); Alternative: [Enamela](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/k-type/enamela), [Gaz](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/gaz), [Flounder](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dominik-krotscheck/Flounder)/ [Floz](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dominik-krotscheck/floz), [Luzern](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/absolut-foundry/luzern), [Abolition](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/abolition) Round  
James B. Beam Distilling Co.: custom as well
Thanks again for all your help
